definition[0]: having an important effect or influence, especially on what will happen in the future
example[0]: His most significant political achievement was the abolition of the death penalty.
example[1]: Please inform us if there are any significant changes in your plans.
example[2]: The result is highly significant for the future of the province.
example[3]: It is significant that the writers of the report were all men.
definition[1]: large enough to be noticeable or have noticeable effects
example[4]: A significant number of drivers fail to keep to speed limits.
example[5]: A significant part of Japanâ€™s wealth is invested in the West.
example[6]: There is a significant difference between the number of home births now and ten years ago.
example[7]: The rise in temperature is not statistically significant.
definition[2]: a significant look, smile etc has a special meaning that is not known to everyone
example[8]: He gave me a significant look.
